findings.issue: Variable name conflicts - 'incomeEffect' used for both calculation result and model input
GDP impact calculation assumes all work hours contribute equally to GDP regardless of productivity

findings.quote: income effects are based on empirical studies of lottery winners
findings.issue: Model assumes lottery/inheritance elasticities apply to regular UBI payments without justification
Wage distribution mixing assumes independence between wage levels and worker proportions
Substitution effect defined as reducing hours for means-testing but UBI is universal, not means-tested

findings.quote: doesn't capture potential productivity gains from reduced financial stress
findings.issue: Model calculates GDP impact from hours reduction but admits it ignores productivity changes
